Row.Text: Sets the maximum level up to which FULL experience can be gained from defeating Barbarians.
Increases the level cap for FULL experience gains from killing Barbarians to level 3 (2 promotions).
Increases the level cap for FULL experience gains from killing Barbarians to level 4 (3 promotions).
Increases the level cap for FULL experience gains from killing Barbarians to level 5 (4 promotions).
Increases the level cap for FULL experience gains from killing Barbarians to level 6 (5 promotions).
Sets the MAXIMUM amount of experience that can be earned from killing Barbarians after the level cap is reached.
Increases the MAXIMUM experience gained from killing Barbarians after the level cap to 2 EXP.
Increases the MAXIMUM experience gained from killing Barbarians after the level cap to 3 EXP.
Increases the MAXIMUM experience gained from killing Barbarians after the level cap to 4 EXP.
Increases the MAXIMUM experience gained from killing Barbarians after the level cap to 5 EXP.
Increases the MAXIMUM experience gained from killing Barbarians after the level cap to 6 EXP.
Increases the MAXIMUM experience gained from killing Barbarians after the level cap to 7 EXP.
Increases the MAXIMUM experience gained from killing Barbarians after the level cap to 8 EXP.
Controls how aggressive barbarians are when they engage in combat. Higher aggression levels mean more frequent and bolder attacks as they gain confidence in battle.
Barbarians are fearful, rarely attacking and retreating after losses, with very low boldness.
Barbarians display standard boldness, attacking opportunistically and recovering at a moderate rate after losses.
Barbarians show moderate boldness, attacking nearby units and recovering some confidence after losses.
Barbarians will show higher boldness, attacking more frequently and recovering faster after losses.
Barbarians become highly aggressive, with boldness increasing faster each turn and frequent attacks.
Barbarians exhibit extreme boldness, attacking relentlessly and almost never retreating after losses.
Adjusts the density of barbarian camps on the map. Higher densities mean more frequent camps with shorter distances between them, increasing the challenge of managing barbarian threats.
Very few barbarian camps, with camps spread far apart and slower spawn rates, creating a less challenging environment.
Default density level, with camps spawning at a standard rate and distance.
Barbarian camp density is increased to moderate levels, with more frequent spawns and closer distances between camps.
Barbarian camps are more common, spawning faster and closer together, increasing the overall challenge.
Barbarian camps spawn frequently and at very short distances from each other and cities, creating a high level of danger.
An abundance of barbarian camps with rapid spawn rates and extremely close proximity to cities, making for an extremely challenging environment.
Controls the frequency at which barbarians spawn units. Higher rates will increase the challenge posed by barbarian camps.
Barbarians spawn units at a much slower rate, providing more time between attacks.
The standard barbarian spawn rate, with moderate intervals between unit spawns.
Barbarians spawn units at a faster rate, shortening the time between attacks.
Barbarian units spawn rapidly, creating a greater threat with little time between waves.
Barbarian spawns occur at an extreme rate, nearly overwhelming the player with constant attacks.
Barbarians spawn units at an unstoppable rate, flooding the map with continuous waves of enemies.
Determines the number of units spawned during a barbarian raid. Higher numbers create larger, more dangerous raids.
Reduces the number of units spawned in a barbarian raid to half of the standard size, making raids smaller and easier to manage.
Barbarian raids will spawn the standard number of units.
Barbarian raids will spawn twice the number of units compared to the standard raid.
Barbarian raids will spawn three times the number of units, significantly increasing the raid's strength.
Barbarian raids will spawn four times the normal number of units, creating a highly dangerous raid force.
Barbarian raids will spawn five times the normal number of units, unleashing an overwhelming assault.
Adjusts the rate at which Barbarian Clans can be converted into city-states, impacting the influence of actions like raids, hires, and bribes.
Slows down Barbarian conversion rate, making it more difficult to influence clans into forming city-states. (Barbarian Clans Mode)
Default rate for Barbarian conversion. (Barbarian Clans Mode)
Increases Barbarian conversion rate slightly, making it easier to influence clans toward forming city-states. (Barbarian Clans Mode)
Doubles the Barbarian conversion rate, allowing faster influence over clans to create city-states. (Barbarian Clans Mode)
Triples the Barbarian conversion rate, enabling a much faster influence over Barbarian clans. (Barbarian Clans Mode)
Quadruples the Barbarian conversion rate, maximizing influence and making clan conversions nearly instantaneous. (Barbarian Clans Mode)
Adjust the technology access and unit availability for barbarians, limiting their early-game power based on the selected era.
Barbarians can spawn Galleys and Quadquiremes at the beginning of the game and mounted units without any tech requirements.
Barbarians no longer have free access to Shipbuilding tech, preventing early Quadquiremes. Horse Archers now require Archery tech to spawn.
Barbarians no longer have free access to both Shipbuilding and Sailing tech, preventing early naval units, and require Horseback Riding tech to spawn mounted units.
Determines whether barbarian camps can spawn and utilize naval units.
Prevents barbarian camps from spawning or using naval units. Naval barbarian camps will behave like standard land-based camps.
Barbarian camps have a low chance of spawning naval units or coastal camps.
Allows barbarian camps to spawn and utilize naval units at the standard rate. (Default)
Barbarian camps have an increased chance of spawning naval units or coastal camps.
Barbarian camps are more likely to spawn naval units and establish coastal camps, posing a greater naval threat.
Barbarian camps prioritize naval units, making coastal regions heavily targeted by barbarian naval forces.
